newsitem.title: USA: Bonneville Power offers unchanged for third day.
newsitem.headline: Bonneville Power offers unchanged for third day.

text.p: The Bonneville Power Administration (BPA) left its offers for next-day firm and non-firm sales unchanged for a third consecutive day, the federal power marketing agency said Thursday.
In addition, Friday sales volumes for firm power between 1300 and 2100 PDT were still limited to 200 megawatts.
Offer prices between those hours are unchanged at $20.00 per megawatt hour (MWh) for firm sales ($19.00 for non-firm) and $18.00 per MWh ($17.00 non-firm) for hours 0700-1200 and 2200-2300.
BPA continued to offer power during early morning hours of 2400 to 0600 PDT on Friday at $13.00 per MWh.
Market sources in the Northwest said the Bonneville offers would continue to be undercut by other generators of hydroelectric power.
